items.title: This tiny protein helps control how hungry you feel
bullets: • Researchers have identified a previously overlooked protein that helps regulate appetite and energy use in the body
• This protein supports a key system that decides whether the body burns energy or stores it, and when it does not function properly, appetite signals can weaken
• Discovery could help scientists better understand how genetic factors contribute to obesity

items.title: Heart attacks increased after Los Angeles wildfires, study finds
bullets: • In the first 90 days after the Palisades and Eaton fires, there was a 46% increase in ER visits for heart attack symptoms at LA’s Cedars-Sinai hospital
• Residents in the zip codes directly affected by the January wildfires or located adjacent to a fire-affected area reported a 24% rise in pulmonary illness

items.title: Physicists 3D-printed a Christmas tree of ice
bullets: • A 3D-printed Christmas tree is made of ice without refrigeration or other freezing technology
• The trick was to house the 3D printing inside a vacuum chamber using a jet nozzle as the printing
• Evaporative cooling is a well-known phenomenon; mammals use it to regulate body temperature
• It's also the main culprit behind the infamous “stall” that so frequently plagues aspiring BBQ pit masters

items.title: US judge will block hundreds of Trump administration layoffs, citing shutdown law

• The widest of those newcomers is Five Nights at Freddy’s 2, which starts out in 3,412 theaters

items.title: The Numbers Business Report: our official forecast for 2026
bullets: • The Numbers Business Report: our official forecast for 2026 box office
• Box office receipts are projected to reach $9.8 billion, a 10% increase on the anticipated 2025 total of $8.87 billion
• The Super Mario Galaxy, due on April 3, tops the slate with forecast receipts of $550 million
• Mid‑tier wide releases are forecast to generate $4.57 billion, up 10% year on year

• The studio is projecting $76 million overseas for a $226 million global debut
